definition: to promote estrus/to bring an animal to heat by artificial means
to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite

sentences.english: Even today, romantic lore commonly identifies chocolate as an aphrodisiac.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫的民间传说通常认为巧克力是一种催情剂。

sentences.english: Restrin sweat, focus attention. Be benefit for stomach and body.
sentences.chinese: 抑汗，催情，集中注意力，利胃，补身。

sentences.english: He increased the reproduction rate of rabbits by inducing oestrus.
sentences.chinese: 他使用催情的方法来提高兔子的繁殖率。

sentences.english: I have the right to know.
sentences.chinese: 我有权知道，霸王花催情水。

sentences.english: While the jukebox plays our favorite song.
sentences.chinese: 电唱机播放着催情的歌曲。

sentences.english: Oysters for example, are supposed to be a sexy aphrodisiac.
sentences.chinese: 拿牡蛎来说吧，被认为是一种性感的催情药。

sentences.english: On the other hand, chocolate is also known for being everything from an anti-depressant to an aphrodisiac.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，巧克力也被誉为抗抑郁剂和催情剂。

sentences.english: You should pay for the electricity and water.
sentences.chinese: 你需要支付水电费，本溪辽阳哪里有卖催情药。

sentences.english: He passed out after three beers.
sentences.chinese: 喝了三杯啤酒后他就醉倒了，催情药用。

sentences.english: No Love Potions, Endless Purses, Parties or Other Entertainment
sentences.chinese: 催情药，百宝囊，宴会表演或其他娱乐活动恕不受理。

definition: to bewitch/to enchant/to cast a spell over sb
(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
to calm (soothe) the nerves/to relieve uneasiness of body and mind
